                    ### Question

### Enhanced Information (For Contextual Support):
Finasteride is a 5α reductase inhibitor that effectively treats both benign prostatic hypertrophy (BPH) and male pattern baldness. It works by inhibiting the conversion of testosterone to dihydrotestosterone (DHT), leading to reduced prostate size and improved BPH symptoms, as well as decreased hair follicle miniaturization, which improves male pattern baldness. Flutamide, an androgen receptor blocker, may affect prostate size but has unclear effects on hair. Prazosin, an alpha-1 adrenergic receptor blocker, improves urinary symptoms in BPH but does not affect hair. Minoxidil, a vasodilator, increases blood flow to hair follicles, improving male pattern baldness but has no effect on the prostate. The evidence paths confirm the mechanisms of action for these drugs, particularly highlighting the role of DHT in both BPH and hair loss, supporting the consensus that Finasteride is effective for both conditions.
